Source code for src.modules.email

"""file to handle emails"""
from typing import Dict

from python_http_client.exceptions import HTTPError
from sendgrid import SendGridAPIClient
from sendgrid.helpers.mail import Mail

from .. import config
from ..utils.response import Response



[docs]class Email:
    """Email actions to handle sendgrid"""

    from_email = tuple([config.FROM_EMAIL_SENDER, config.FROM_EMAIL_SENDER_NAME])
    sendgrid_api_key = config.SENDGRID_API_KEY
    templates = config.SENGRID_TEMPLATES
    url = config.HOST

    def __init__(self):
        pass


[docs]    def confirms_registration(self, data: Dict, token: str) -> dict:
        """Send email to confirm registration
        Args:
            data (dict): data to send
            token (str): token to send
        Returns:
            dict: response
        """
        # check if request is not empty
        if data is None:
            return dict(code="0008")
        if token is None:
            return dict(code="0003")

        email = data["username"]
        name = f"{data['first_name']} {data['last_name']}"
        to_email = tuple([email, name])
        subject = "Confirm your E-mail"
        message = Mail(
            from_email=self.from_email,
            to_emails=[to_email],
            subject=subject,
        )
        message.dynamic_template_data = dict(
            name=name,
            action_url=f"{self.url}/confirmEmail?token={token}",
            username=email,
        )
        #
        message.template_id = self.templates["confirm_registration"]
        try:
            sg = SendGridAPIClient(self.sendgrid_api_key)
            response = sg.send(message)

            return dict(
                message="Email sent successfully", status_code=response.status_code
            )
        except HTTPError as error:
            return dict(message=f"Error sending email: {error.to_dict}", code="0009")



[docs]    def reset_password(self, data: dict) -> dict:
        """reset_password _summary_
        Args:
            data (dict): data to send
        Returns:
            dict: response
        """
        # check if request is not empty
        if data is None:
            return dict(code="0008")

        email = data["email"]
        name = f"{data['first_name']} {data['last_name']}"
        to_email = tuple([email, name])
        subject = "Reset your password"
        message = Mail(
            from_email=self.from_email,
            to_emails=[to_email],
            subject=subject,
        )
        message.dynamic_template_data = dict(
            name=name,
            action_url=f"{self.url}/resetPassword?email={email}",
            username=email,
        )
        message.template_id = self.templates["reset_password"]
        try:
            sg = SendGridAPIClient(self.sendgrid_api_key)
            response = sg.send(message)
            return dict(
                message="Email for password reset sent, please check your inbox",
                status_code=response.status_code,
            )
        except HTTPError as error:
            return dict(message=f"Error sending email: {error.to_dict}", code="0009")
